intro: Minuartia anatolica var. scleranthoides, commonly known as the Anatolian rock-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the rocky regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its compact growth form and ability to survive in harsh environments make it an important component of mountain ecosystems. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
